body.p: A Kentucky attorney, educator, farmer, soldier, and politician. Educated in local county schools and self taught. Served as deputy county surveyor of Jessamine County, Kentucky. Engaged in farming and surveying in Daviess County, Kentucky. Served as Daviess County surveyor for seventeen years. Married to Pamelia A. Head Triplett. Father of Mary Triplett May, Robert S. Triplett, George V. Triplett, Sarah Kate Triplett, Joseph F. Triplett, Margaret M. Triplett Howard, John H. Triplett, Pamelia M. Triplett Jewett, Octavio V. Triplett Seaton, George W. Triplett, Jr., Thomas Triplett, Jr., and Rebecca Triplett Samuel. Served as a Whig member of the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1840. Served as a Whig member of the Kentucky Senate from 1848 to 1850. Served as a captain in the First Kentucky Cavalry of the Confederate States of America and as a major in the Quartermasters Corps from 1861 to 1864. Elected to serve the Second Congressional District as a member of the Second Confederate Congress in the House of Representatives from 1864 to 1865.
